terms.disclaimer: Please read these Terms carefully before using our ZSSF HALL RESERVATION System.

intro.heading: 1. Introduction
intro.text: These Terms govern the use of our Online Hall Management and Booking System. By using the System, you agree to comply with the stated conditions. Continuing to use the System indicates your acceptance of these Terms below.

scope.heading: 2. Use of the System
scope.text: The System is used to allow applicants to view available halls, check availability, book their preferred hall, and make payments.

booking.heading: 3. Booking Terms and Conditions
list: The user must provide accurate information when using this system.
Applicants must request venue bookings through this system.
The availability of the venue will be confirmed once payment or proof of payment is received.
Applicants must specify if special requests (chairs, tables, etc.) are needed during the booking; such requests may incur additional costs.
All established terms must be followed, including the maximum capacity limit set for the venue, and all rules must be respected at all times.
The system will hold a booking request for 24 hours while waiting for payment, counted from the time the booking request is made.

The customer must pay at least 50% within 24 hours. If payment is not made within this period, the booking will be automatically canceled, the venue will become available to others, and any amount already paid will be forfeited.

payment.heading: 4. Payment Terms
list: You must make payments using the Payment Control Number provided by the System.
You are required to pay an advance payment of 50% of the hall booking fee.
Accepted payment methods include mobile money services (M-Pesa, Mixx by YAS, Airtel Money), bank transfers, and direct bank payments.
The Fund will not be responsible for any loss of money before the payment is confirmed by the System.

cancellation.heading: 5. Cancellations and Refunds
list: There are two types of cancellations:

1) If a user cancels immediately after paying 50%, a 25% cancellation fee will be deducted. The remaining 25% can be refunded by contacting the hall staff. Each hall shows the contact phone number of the responsible staff member.

2) In the case of postponement (for example, due to an emergency), the customer will not be allowed to postpone until the full payment (100%) has been made. The system allows postponement only twice. After that, the customer must start a new booking process, and for refund or payment matters, they must contact the responsible hall staff whose phone number is shown on the hall page.

responsibilities.heading: 6. User Responsibilities
list: Users must follow the hall rules and regulations established by the Management.
Users are responsible for any damage to hall property and must cover repair costs for such damage.
Cleanliness must be maintained; all waste must be properly disposed of, and the venue should be left clean.

prohibited.heading: 7. Prohibited Activities
list: Engaging in activities that violate Zanzibari morals, indecent behavior, or the use of dangerous materials or equipment is prohibited.
Subleasing the hall to another person is not allowed.
Excessive noise is strictly prohibited.
Violation of these terms may result in removal from the venue and loss of payments. Severe violations will be reported to the relevant authorities and may lead to legal action.

liability.heading: 8. Liability
list: The Fund is responsible for the condition of the hall and the services provided.
The Fund shall not be liable for any loss, damage, or injury occurring during events at the hall unless required by law.

privacy.heading: 9. Privacy and Data Protection
privacy.text: All information provided will be handled securely and confidentially in accordance with legal requirements. Data may be disclosed only when required by law.

modifications.heading: 10. Changes to the Terms
modifications.text: We may revise these Terms from time to time. Any changes will be published and communicated to users. Continued use of the System indicates your acceptance of the new Terms.

law.heading: 11. Governing Law
list: These Terms are governed by the Laws of Zanzibar.
Disputes will be resolved in the appropriate courts.

terms.contactText: For questions or disputes, please contact support through the System or call the hall’s support number.

INVOICE.HEADING: Invoice
INVOICE.CONGRATS_SUB: Congratulations {{name}}, your booking was successful, receive your invoice below!

GUIDANCE.TITLE: Read payment Guidance and invoice
GUIDANCE.HTML:
You have 24 hours to pay your advance 25% of the total via control number {{pcn}}, if not so the booking will expire. You may update booking dates only if needed.

.

To pay this bill, use the provided Payment Control Number {{pcn}} at any authorized channel. Options include bank deposit/transfer or mobile money (M-Pesa, Tigo Pesa/Mix, Airtel Money, Halopesa)

.

How to Pay!

1.Bank Deposit or Transfer: Go to any branch or agent of a GePG-integrated bank (e.g. NMB, CRDB, TPB, NBC).Inform the teller you are making a government payment and give them the Payment Control Number found in your invoice as the reference number.Pay in cash or by electronic transfer.

.

(For online/mobile banking or ATM: select “Bill Pay” or “Government Payments” and enter the Payment Control Number.) Keep the deposit slip or transaction confirmation as proof.

.

2.Mobile Money Payment:

M-Pesa (Vodacom):Dial *150*00#, select Lipa Bili (Pay Bills), then Government Payments, and enter the PCN when prompted.

Tigo Pesa (Mix by Yass): Dial *150*01#, select Lipa Bili (usually option 4) then Government Payment (option 5), and enter the PCN.

Airtel Money: Dial *150*60#, choose Lipa Bili → Government Payments, then input the PCN.

Halopesa (Halotel): Dial *150*88#, choose Lipa Bili → Government Payments, then input the PCN

.

After entering the PCN and the amount, confirm with your mobile money PIN. You will receive an SMS receipt confirming the payment.

.

Always double-check that the PCN and amount are correct. The GePG system will automatically apply your payment using the PCN.Keep any receipt or confirmation as proof of payment.
